chapter.title: Touch Userguide
chapter.para: TOUCH is the second application that is delivered to you. TOUCH implements some of the examples of the book ''Touch of Class''. Note that the examples as described in TOUCH are not totally equivalent to their description in the text book. At the time of this writing not all the examples of the book are implemented yet. So TOUCH needs to be taken with a pinch of salt!

section.title: How does this application work?
section.para:
Each chapter respectively each example has its own application. All look almost the same for except some minor changes to meet the requirements of the individual exercise. The window has on its right side the control panel where the user can zoom in or zoom out. Dependant on the exercise there are more buttons to click (for example a restart button etc.).
<-- On the left side you can see the chapters and their examples. To change between the examples from the book and the exercises use the two buttons on the bottom left of the screen. Simply click on an example and some information together with a picture will pop up on the right side. To see the example in action use the run example button on the right. What happens after you pressed the button depends on the implementation of the example, but in most of the examples you will get a screen like this -->
You navigate on the map by pressing the mouse buttons.

listitem.para: Pressing the right mouse button while moving the mouse will scroll the map.
Moving the mouse up or down while pressing the middle mouse button will zoom in or out.
Clicking the left mouse button will select places or lines.

section.para: To get back to the menu simply click the End Example button.
